nodes.bodyText:
This probably can be simplified into:
return Close(fd, false);
The PR class still has a reference on SSLFDProxy. I think ideally NSPR classes should not deal with SSL.

I think that's fine -- its a simplification over Close(PRFDProxy, boolean) -- otherwise, callers would have to know that SSLFDProxy has to be closed via Close(fd, false) and keep that in mind at every call site.
If this is a purely object-oriented design, such details should have been handled in PRFDProxy.close() and SSLFDProxy.close(), but let's not worry about this internal API.
